result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Laprada J Cross not in court, defendant in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed. nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $60,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified legal appointments.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Laprada J Cross in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Laprada J Cross in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laprada J Cross appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
